title: Fan, 1952-161-198, 1700–25
description: Brisé fan. Sticks of painted and varnished ivory; tortoiseshell thumb guard; silk connecting ribbon; mother-of-pearl washer at the rivet. In this example of a Vernis Martin fan, the central cartouche depicts Bacchus discovering Ariadne on the shore of the island of Naxos where she had been abandoned by Theseus.
